genres.name: Synthwave
genres.description: Retro-futuristic electronic music inspired by 1980s film soundtracks, video games, and synth-pop. Pulsing arpeggios, warm analog synths, and driving drum machines create a neon-lit atmosphere.

genres.name: Vaporwave
genres.description: Slowed-down, chopped samples from 80s and 90s muzak, smooth jazz, and corporate elevator music. A surreal, ironic nostalgia for consumer culture filtered through digital haze.

genres.name: Lo-fi Hip Hop
genres.description: Warm, crackling beats with mellow jazz samples, vinyl hiss, and soft Rhodes chords. The soundtrack to late-night studying, rainy afternoons, and quiet contemplation.

genres.name: Ambient
genres.description: Expansive, atmospheric soundscapes that prioritize texture and mood over rhythm or melody. Drifting pads, field recordings, and shimmering tones create immersive sonic environments.

genres.name: Chillwave
genres.description: Sun-bleached, woozy synth-pop with lo-fi production, reverb-soaked vocals, and nostalgic summer vibes. Equal parts dreamy and melancholic, like a Polaroid fading in the sun.

genres.name: House
genres.description: Four-on-the-floor dance music with soulful vocals, warm bass, and infectious grooves. Born in Chicago warehouses, house music brings people together on the dancefloor with uplifting energy.

genres.name: Deep House
genres.description: Smoother, moodier cousin of house with deeper bass, jazzy chords, and understated grooves. Perfect for sunset sets, rooftop bars, and late-night conversations.

genres.name: Techno
genres.description: Relentless, hypnotic electronic music driven by mechanical rhythms and industrial textures. Born in Detroit, techno thrives in dark warehouses and underground clubs where the beat is everything.

genres.name: Trance
genres.description: Euphoric, soaring electronic music built on arpeggiated synths, epic breakdowns, and transcendent buildups. Designed to induce a state of elevated consciousness on the dancefloor.

brian_tracks.title: The Inner Eye (Vision of the Void)

genres.name: Drum and Bass
genres.description: High-velocity breakbeats and deep, rolling basslines at 160+ BPM. From liquid rollers to heavy neurofunk, DnB is pure kinetic energy channeled through rhythm and sub-bass.

genres.name: Dubstep
genres.description: Heavy bass drops, wobbly synths, and half-time rhythms that hit like seismic waves. Evolved from UK garage and dub, dubstep ranges from dark and brooding to aggressive and filthy.

genres.name: Future Bass
genres.description: Shimmering, emotional electronic music with lush synth chords, pitched vocals, and uplifting drops. Colorful and euphoric, like sunlight through prisms.

genres.name: IDM
genres.description: Intellectually adventurous electronic music that deconstructs rhythm, melody, and structure. Glitchy textures, complex time signatures, and unpredictable arrangements reward deep listening.

genres.name: Downtempo
genres.description: Slow, groovy electronic music that blends organic instruments with digital production. Mid-tempo rhythms, world music influences, and lush atmospheres perfect for unwinding.

genres.name: Trip-Hop
genres.description: Dark, cinematic fusion of hip-hop beats, moody atmospherics, and ethereal vocals. Born in Bristol, trip-hop soundtracks shadowy urban nights with slow-burning intensity.

genres.name: Industrial
genres.description: Abrasive, mechanical music built from distorted synths, clanging metal, and confrontational noise. Industrial fuses electronic production with punk aggression and dystopian themes.

genres.name: Indie Rock
genres.description: Guitar-driven alternative rock with DIY spirit, jangly melodies, and introspective lyrics. From basement shows to festival stages, indie rock balances vulnerability with urgency.

genres.name: Shoegaze
genres.description: Walls of distorted, reverb-drenched guitars that blur into a shimmering, overwhelming wash of sound. Buried vocals float beneath layers of feedback and ethereal noise.

genres.name: Post-Rock
genres.description: Cinematic instrumental rock that builds from delicate quiet to overwhelming crescendos. Patient, emotional, and expansive, post-rock tells stories without words through dynamics and texture.

genres.name: Grunge
genres.description: Raw, heavy alternative rock drenched in distortion and existential angst. Born in Seattle's rain-soaked basements, grunge strips rock to its emotional core with unflinching honesty.

genres.name: Punk
genres.description: Fast, loud, stripped-down rock fueled by attitude and anti-establishment energy. Three chords, two minutes, one message: do it yourself and question everything.

genres.name: Emo
genres.description: Emotionally charged punk-influenced rock with confessional lyrics, dynamic shifts between quiet and loud, and cathartic vocal performances that wear the heart on the sleeve.

genres.name: Math Rock
genres.description: Technically intricate rock with complex time signatures, tapping guitar patterns, and angular rhythms. Cerebral yet visceral, math rock turns musicianship into a spectacle of precision.

genres.name: Psychedelic Rock
genres.description: Mind-expanding rock that uses swirling guitars, phased effects, and extended jams to alter perception. Kaleidoscopic and boundary-dissolving, psych rock opens doors of perception.

genres.name: Progressive Rock
genres.description: Ambitious, complex rock that draws from classical, jazz, and experimental traditions. Long compositions, shifting time signatures, and virtuosic musicianship push rock beyond conventional boundaries.

genres.name: Garage Rock
genres.description: Raw, lo-fi rock 'n' roll played with maximum attitude and minimum polish. Fuzzy guitars, stomping rhythms, and primal energy straight from the garage to the stage.

genres.name: Boom Bap
genres.description: Classic East Coast hip-hop with hard-hitting drums, jazzy samples, and lyrical virtuosity. Boom bap keeps it real with head-nodding beats and sharp wordplay from the golden era.

genres.name: Trap
genres.description: Hard-hitting Southern hip-hop with rolling hi-hats, deep 808 bass, and aggressive energy. Trap dominates modern hip-hop with its dark, atmospheric, and bass-heavy production style.

genres.name: Jazz Rap
genres.description: Hip-hop that leans into live jazz instrumentation, complex harmonies, and sophisticated lyricism. Jazz rap bridges improvisation and flow, creating something cerebral yet groovy.

genres.name: Neo-Soul
genres.description: Warm, organic reinvention of classic soul with modern production, jazzy chords, and deeply personal vocals. Neo-soul is intimate, sensual, and rooted in authentic musical expression.

genres.name: R&B
genres.description: Rhythm and blues spanning silky vocals, lush production, and emotional depth. From classic Motown grooves to modern alternative R&B, the genre centers the human voice and feeling.

genres.name: Phonk
genres.description: Dark, sample-heavy hip-hop drawing from Memphis rap, chopped-and-screwed, and drift culture. Cowbell-laden beats, distorted 808s, and an aggressive, haunting aesthetic.

genres.name: Jazz
genres.description: The art of improvisation and swing. From smoky club performances to complex compositions, jazz is conversation between musicians — spontaneous, surprising, and deeply human.

genres.name: Classical
genres.description: Centuries of Western art music spanning intimate chamber works to sweeping orchestral symphonies. Classical music explores the full range of human emotion through composed, notated music.

genres.name: Bossa Nova
genres.description: Gentle, swaying Brazilian music blending samba rhythms with jazz harmonics. Soft guitar, whispered vocals, and warm melodies conjure sun-dappled beaches and quiet afternoons.

genres.name: Folk
genres.description: Acoustic, story-driven music rooted in tradition and community. Guitar, banjo, and fiddle accompany tales of love, loss, and the human condition with simple, honest beauty.

genres.name: Blues
genres.description: Raw emotional expression through bent guitar notes, shuffle rhythms, and soulful vocals. The blues is the root of modern popular music, turning pain and joy into universal art.

genres.name: Country
genres.description: Twangy guitars, steel pedals, and fiddle melodies tell stories of heartbreak, freedom, and open roads. Country music pairs honest storytelling with the wide-open American landscape.

genres.name: Soul
genres.description: Passionate vocal performances over gospel-influenced arrangements with horns, strings, and deep grooves. Soul music channels raw emotion — joy, heartache, love, struggle — through the voice.

genres.name: Funk
genres.description: Groove-heavy music driven by syncopated bass, tight rhythms, and irresistible danceability. Funk makes the body move with its pocket rhythms, wah-wah guitars, and celebratory spirit.

genres.name: Reggae
genres.description: Offbeat rhythms, deep bass, and conscious lyrics from Jamaica. Reggae spreads messages of love, resistance, and unity over laid-back grooves that make you sway in the sun.

genres.name: Afrobeat
genres.description: Pulsing, polyrhythmic West African music fusing jazz, funk, and highlife with politically charged lyrics. Extended jams, horn sections, and layered percussion create irresistible momentum.

genres.name: K-Pop
genres.description: Highly polished, genre-blending pop from South Korea featuring precise choreography, catchy hooks, and immaculate production. K-pop maximizes energy, visuals, and fan connection.

genres.name: Metal
genres.description: Heavy, aggressive music defined by powerful riffs, thundering drums, and intense vocals. Metal spans a vast spectrum from melodic power metal to extreme death metal, united by sheer sonic force.

genres.name: Electro Swing
genres.description: Vintage jazz and swing samples fused with modern electronic beats. Brass stabs meet four-on-the-floor kicks, creating an irresistible fusion of old-world charm and dancefloor energy.

genres.name: New Wave
genres.description: Synth-driven post-punk pop with angular guitars, electronic textures, and art-school aesthetics. New wave made electronic experimentation accessible with catchy hooks and stylish attitude.

genres.name: Dream Pop
genres.description: Gossamer vocals floating over shimmering guitars, lush synths, and gentle rhythms. Dream pop wraps the listener in a cocoon of beauty, creating music that feels like a waking dream.

genres.name: Witch House
genres.description: Dark, occult-tinged electronic music with pitched-down vocals, eerie samples, and slow, heavy beats. A haunted intersection of hip-hop, noise, and gothic atmosphere.

genres.name: City Pop
genres.description: Glossy, sophisticated Japanese pop from the late 70s and 80s blending funk, disco, and AOR. Urban optimism, neon-lit nights, and breezy melodies from Tokyo's economic boom era.

genres.name: Hardcore Punk
genres.description: Faster, harder, angrier evolution of punk rock with breakneck tempos, shouted vocals, and stripped-down fury. Hardcore channels pure adrenaline into short, explosive bursts of sound.

genres.name: Electronic
genres.description: Broad umbrella of synthesizer-driven music spanning from delicate bleeps to massive soundscapes. Electronic music reimagines what instruments and compositions can be in the digital age.
